a.title: The Governor's School of Southside Virginia
a.span: The Governor's School of Southside Virginia

li.a: The Governor's School of Southside Virginia

span.style: font-size: 24px;

p.span: Starting tomorrow, all students who sign into Google Classroom must use their CCPS email account username and password due to security concerns. If you need your child’s username and password, please contact Duffie Jones at jonesmd@ccps.k12.va.us (Elementary) or Karen Osborne at osbornek@ccps.k12.va.us (Middle and High)

span.style: font-size: 16px;

p.span: Elementary and Middle School Students who didn’t pick up a packet today will have an opportunity to do so next Tuesday, May 5th at the different sites. High School students who signed up to receive a packet and didn’t pick it up today will have the opportunity to pick it up tomorrow, April 29th at the School Board Office.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);
span.br: Please click on the Google Classroom Continuing Education. The classroom codes are case sensitive.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);
font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

p.span: Middle School Google Classroom Code: hgxbgpb

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);
font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

p.span: I have attached a PowerPoint with instructions of how to access Google Classroom. If you have any questions, please reach out to Duffie Jones at jonesmd@ccps.k12.va.us (Elementary) and Karen Osborne at osbornek@ccps.k12.va.us (Middle and High).

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

p.span: Remember that Google Classroom is optional. If you do not have internet access or prefer packets, they will be distributed at the meal distribution sites and the School Board Office tomorrow. The packets are optional as well.

span.style: font-size: 22px; font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

br.br: Please notice a new tab named COVID-19 on our site. We will post updates from our State Superintendent and Mr. Mason with regard to our schools and COVID-19.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif; color: black;
span.a: Please click on this link for the Frequently Asked Questions Document.

span.style: font-size: 14px; text-align: start; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

br.span: This document will be updated as additional information becomes available.

span.style: font-family: inherit;

div.span: When will screenings be completed for children who have applied for Pre-K for the 2020-21 school year?

div.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 14px; text-align: center; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.style: font-family: inherit;

div.span: Pre-K applications are due by April 30, 2020. These applications may be placed in the drop box outside the elementary school to which your child is applying. Screenings will be completed once officials deem it safe to do so.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif; color: black;
font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 0, 0);
font-size: 18pt;

img.title: pick up
img.br:
The CCPS Meal Pick-up Program will be held each date at the 10 locations on the flyer. If you are interested in our meal pick-up program, please help our Food Service Department by completing the survey!
http://tiny.cc/9p5fmz

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Century Gothic", sans-serif;

p.span:
Parents, please be sure to collect your child’s instructional packet, and keep those for next school year. This completed work will help our teachers assess areas in which students may need additional remediation. Guidance from the Virginia Department of Education recommends that school divisions not grade work assigned during school closures. Following the guidance from the State, Charlotte County Public Schools will not be grading instructional packets. We are constantly updating our division website with activities provided by our teachers and administrators to help you keep your child academically engaged.
Parents/Guardians, CCPS is providing continuity of learning during the closure of school. Please click on the link below to open the document. All content, K-3, 4-5, Middle School and High School are listed on the tabs at the bottom of the spreadsheet. Once you click on one of these tabs, you will see each grade level and content area. Website names and links are listed as online resources for our students. If you have any issues accessing the form or questions about any websites, please contact:

div.span: This website is in the process of being updated to ensure accessibility and compliance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act. During this process, any website accessibility concerns may be brought to the attention of the Webmaster via email webmaster@ccps.k12.va.us or phone: (434) 542-5151.
